bug.short_desc: [1.8] disassembler output should print actual strings for bootstrap methods

long_desc.thetext:
The disassembler output should print actual strings for bootstrap methods, not just constant pool index #s.
E.g. for the example in bug 422016 comment 10, I get:
Bootstrap methods: 0 : # 67 arguments: {#68,#71,#72}
Expected:
Bootstrap methods: 0 : #67 invokestatic java/lang/invoke/LambdaMetafactory.metafactory:(Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodHandles$Lookup;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodHandle;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;)Ljava/lang/invoke/CallSite; arguments: #68 ()V #71 invokestatic jsr335/Main.lambda$0:()V #72 ()V

I understand the changes have to be somewhere here:
org.eclipse.jdt.core/model/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/core/util/Disassembler.java
Function: disassemble(IBootstrapMethodsAttribute bootstrapMethodsAttribute, StringBuffer buffer, String lineSeparator, int tabNumber.

Created attachment 239420 Patch: With nexessary bootstrap method and arguments display changes
I have made the necessary changes.
Please run a test case e.g. test004 (org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler/src/org/eclipse/jdt/core/tests/compiler/regression/JSR335ClassFileTest.java)
to see the effect of the changes.
--------- Bootstrap methods: 0 : # 37 invokestatic java/lang/invoke/LambdaMetafactory.metafactory:(Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodHandles$Lookup;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodHandle;Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;)Ljava/lang/invoke/CallSite; Method arguments:\n #39 ()Ljava/lang/String; #45 java/lang/String.toString:()Ljava/lang/String; #46 ()Ljava/lang/String; ----------
If the format is acceptable, I will make changes in all the test cases.
Thanks
Thanks for the patch Shankha, as I am finding it difficult to schedule time for this task, I am retargetting this to 4.4

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #3)
> If the format is acceptable, I will make changes in all the test cases.
This looks fine to me.
Sorry, didn't realize a patch is available. Yes we will consider this for Java 8.

Created attachment 239548 Patch
Complete Patch. All test results are green.
Thanks
Shankha, sorry to postpone this, I have absolutely no time now :(

Shankha, just glanced over the patch and have a question:
In getBootstrapArgumentsName(), is there a reason why we need the cases such as CONSTANT_String - we don't seem to be doing anything in those cases.

Created attachment 242037 Patch
In sync with latest code.
(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #9) > Shankha, just glanced over the patch and have a question: > > In getBootstrapArgumentsName(), is there a reason why we need the cases such > as CONSTANT_String - we don't seem to be doing anything in those cases.
Hi Jay, I just kept it as placeholder. When we encounter a bootstrap argument which is string we could add: arguments[i] = constantPoolEntry.getStringValue()
Thanks

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #10) > I just kept it as placeholder. > When we encounter a bootstrap argument which is string we could add: > arguments[i] = constantPoolEntry.getStringValue()
Do you mean in future when we could have bootstrap arguments that are string? If there is no use for it now, we should get rid of it. We can add it as and when required.

Created attachment 242127 Patch
Removing changes which are not needed as of now. Few additional changes for new test cases which have been added. Test results are green.
Thanks

Created attachment 242237 Patch
1) I have moved the code from BootstrapMethodsEntry to Disaasembler. 2) I have made extracted code for getting method details into a separate function. 3) The format of the message has not been changed from the previous patch as it is much more readable.
Test results are green. Thanks

Thanks Shankha, I have released the fix in master:
http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=4f8754b531ef7a0f61f91d095d8127db2debc51a
Verified for 4.4 M7 using I20140429-2000 build

attachment.desc: Patch: With nexessary bootstrap method and arguments display changes
